info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 10 at 12:22AM CDT until June 10 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN COMANCHE...SOUTHWESTERN CADDO...JACKSON...KIOWA... NORTHWESTERN TILLMAN...SOUTHEASTERN HARMON...NORTHWESTERN WILBARGER AND HARDEMAN COUNTIES... At 1221 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hobart to near Tom Steed Reservoir to 6 miles northeast of Headrick to 4 miles south of Humphreys to near Odell to 3 miles west of Quanah, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...The Altus Mesonet measured a 71 mph wind gust. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Altus, Vernon, Frederick, Hobart, Quanah, Cache, Snyder, Tipton, Blair, Chillicothe, Olustee, Eldorado, Mountain Park, Medicine Park, Indiahoma, Davidson, Roosevelt, Gotebo, Manitou and Martha. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
